<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Not so surprisingly given the data, similarity scores top out at 17.  This is reasonable given that the maximum score has an upper-bound equal to the maximum title length due to the use of the dot product in calculating the similarity score and the maximum number of unique words in a title (shown below) is 19 words.  Most scores are below 10, with only about 1000 hitting 10 or above.  This is also in line with the data observed below.  Overall, the distribution of scores seems reasonable given the title lengths and the basic idea that most words in the dataset are sparse and therefore not shared between documents (queries / titles).</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [25]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">title_lengths</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">articles</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'title_bow'</span><span class="p">]),</span> <span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">title_lengths</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">describe</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[25]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>count    1098.000000
mean        9.023679
std         2.562507
min         2.000000
25%         7.000000
50%         9.000000
75%        11.000000
max        19.000000
dtype: float64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Evaluation">Evaluation<a class="anchor-link" href="#Evaluation">¶</a></h1>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Utilizing the pre-defined groups from PhysOrg, we can compare Query - Document scores for (Query, Document) pairs in which both the Query and the Document are associated with the same category to (Query, Document) pairs in which the Query is associated one category and the Document is associated with a different category.</p>
<p>Since we are performing these analyses within the context of Information Retrieval and Search Engines, we will evaluate the Top 10 highest scoring Documents for each Query in terms of whether the Query and Documents share the same PhysOrg category.</p>
<p>We will first review the fraction of document types returned for all queries from a given category, and then look to evalute the method explored in this article using the F-Measure.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [26]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">top10</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">query_doc_sims</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">argsort</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)[:,</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">:]</span>
<span class="n">top10</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">top10</span><span class="p">[:,</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">reversed</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">))]]</span>
<span class="n">top10</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pandas</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">top10</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">11</span><span class="p">)])</span>
<span class="n">top10</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Doc'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">top10</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">top10</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Category'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">top10</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">articles</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">category</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Doc'</span><span class="p">]],</span> <span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Document-Types-Returned-by-Category">Document Types Returned by Category<a class="anchor-link" href="#Document-Types-Returned-by-Category">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>For this portion of the analysis, we will look into 4 questions:</p>
<ul>
<li>What percentage of the time is the highest-scored document the document itself?</li>
<li>What percentage of the time is the document itself within the top 10 highest scored documents?</li>
<li>What percentage of the time is a document sharing the document in question's cetegory the top ranked document?</li>
<li>For each category, what is the categorical break-down of documents in the top 10 list across all documents in that category?</li>
</ul>
<p>The first three questions are answered directly below.  Intuitively, we should expect a "good" method to return the respective document for a query most of the time. 75% of the time seems somewhat reasonable, though it would be reasonable to assume that we could do better.  In the same vein, a 90% hit rate for returning the associated document in the Top 10 List is respectable, but also leaves much room for improvement.  We will primarily use these values to compare to the next method we impliment.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [27]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Doc as first, Doc in top 10</span>
<span class="n">doc_first</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">top10</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="n">top10</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">top10</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="mi">100</span>
<span class="n">doc_top10</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">top10</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Doc'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">set</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">]),</span> <span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">top10</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="mi">100</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"A query's respective document is returned first </span><span class="si">{0:0.1f}% o</span><span class="s2">f the time"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">doc_first</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"A query's respective document is returned within the first 10 documents </span><span class="si">{0:0.1f}% o</span><span class="s2">f the time"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">doc_top10</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="c1"># Doc Category as first</span>
<span class="n">cat_first</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">top10</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">articles</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">category</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]]</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="n">articles</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">category</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Doc'</span><span class="p">]],</span> <span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">top10</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="mi">100</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"A query's respective document category is returned first </span><span class="si">{0:0.1f}% o</span><span class="s2">f the time"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">cat_first</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>A query's respective document is returned first 73.4% of the time
A query's respective document is returned within the first 10 documents 90.3% of the time
A query's respective document category is returned first 86.7% of the time
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [28]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">catLookup</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">articles</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">category</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">11</span><span class="p">]])</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">sameCat</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">cat</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Category'</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">cats</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">catLookup</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">c</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="n">cat</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">c</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">cats</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">sameCatCount</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">same_cats</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sameCat</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">same_cats</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="n">top10</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'same_cat_count'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">top10</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">sameCatCount</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [29]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Count occurrences of each Major 8 type in the top 10 list for each Major 8 type</span>
<span class="n">total_counts</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
<span class="n">inds</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">ind</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">m8</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">enumerate</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pandas</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">articles</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">category</span><span class="p">)):</span>
    <span class="n">sub</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">numpy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">array</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">articles</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">category</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="n">m8</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">dtype</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">bool</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">sub_tt</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">numpy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">array</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">top10</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ix</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">sub</span><span class="p">][[</span><span class="n">i</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">11</span><span class="p">)]])</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">flatten</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">sub_tt_categories</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">articles</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">category</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">sub_tt</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">sub_counts</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">nltk</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">FreqDist</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sub_tt_categories</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">total_counts</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sub_counts</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">inds</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">m8</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">total_counts</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pandas</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">total_counts</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">total_counts</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">inds</span>
<span class="n">total_counts</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">total_counts</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">inds</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [30]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Frac of total documents in top 10 of each M8, by each M8</span>
<span class="n">total_fracs</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">numpy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">array</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">total_counts</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">total_fracs</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">numpy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply_along_axis</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="nb">sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">total_fracs</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">total_fracs</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pandas</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">total_fracs</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">inds</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">inds</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [31]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Plot heatmap of the results</span>
<span class="n">cmap</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">cubehelix_palette</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">start</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">rot</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">dark</span><span class="o">=.</span><span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">light</span><span class="o">=.</span><span class="mi">87</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">as_cmap</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">g</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">heatmap</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">total_fracs</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">annot</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cmap</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">cmap</span><span class="p">);</span>
<span class="n">g</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">figure</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_size_inches</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">);</span>

<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xticks</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">size</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">);</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">yticks</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">size</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">);</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>For a more comprehensive picture of the method's performance, we analyze the fraction of each document type returned in the Top 10 List for each document type.  Each square in the heatmap above represents the fraction of the column category's documents returned in the Top 10 List for a query associated with the row category.  For example, for queries associated with the "science-news" category (row 2), about 29% of the total documents returned in the Top 10 Lists were from the "technology-news" category (column 6).</p>
<p>While we see a fairly strong diagonal (i.e. queries returning documents from the same category), the overall performance is not particularly encouraging outside of "technology-news", which also happens to have the largest number of documents in the collection by far.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Evaluation-with-the-F-Measure">Evaluation with the F-Measure<a class="anchor-link" href="#Evaluation-with-the-F-Measure">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Eyeballing the data is not particularly conducive for comparing results.  Luckily, the IR field has provided some useful measures for evaluating an arbitrary method's performance, the most notable of which are <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Precision_and_recall">Precision and Recall</a>.  Precision evaluates the fraction of returned documents that are from the target class or category, while recall looks at the fraction of target documents in the entire collection returned.  More precisly:</p>
<p><em>precision = (total relevant documents returned) / (total documents returned)</em></p>
<p><em>recall = (total relevant documents returned) / (total relevant documents in the collection)</em></p>
<p>While both of these metrics help evaluate a method, having a single value for comparing methods would be even more useful.  The <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/F1_score">F-Measure</a> combines Precision and Recall into a single metric that can be used to compare methods.  The traditional -- or balanced -- F-Measure is calculated as follows:</p>
$$F = 2 \cdot \frac{precision \cdot recall}{precision + recall}$$<p>Note that this metric is meant to evaluate a single query.  We will calculate the average F-Measure across all queries (1) in each category and (2) in our dataset to obtain average F-Measures.</p>
<p>To do this, we first add the total document counts for each category to the "total_counts" data frame.  Then, for each query entry in the "top10" data frame, we calculate the F-Measure.  After calculating F-Measures for individual queries, we find the mean F-Measure for all queries in a category, and then calculate the overall mean F-Measure.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [32]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">total_counts</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'total_docs'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">numpy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">array</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">nltk</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">FreqDist</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">articles</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">category</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="n">c</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">c</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">total_counts</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [33]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">total_counts</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [34]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">recall</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">tot</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rel</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">tot</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">precision</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ret</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rel</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">ret</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">fMeasure</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ret</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">tot</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">r</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">recall</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">tot</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">p</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">precision</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ret</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">fm</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">2</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">r</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">p</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">r</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">p</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">fm</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">fFromX</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">cat</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Category'</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">tot</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">total_counts</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'total_docs'</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="n">cat</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">fMeasure</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'same_cat_count'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">tot</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [35]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">top10</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'FMeasure'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">top10</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">fFromX</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [36]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">top10</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'Category'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">agg</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s1">'FMeasure'</span> <span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'mean'</span><span class="p">})</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output">

<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [37]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Overall F-Measure: </span><span class="si">{0:0.3f}</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">numpy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">top10</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">FMeasure</span><span class="p">)))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Overall F-Measure: 0.056
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>At this point, we can compare category performances to one another and see that queries from the "space-news" category obtained better F-Measures and any other category.  Overall though, the F-Measures are rather disappointing, as the best possible score is 1.</p>
<p>It should be noted that obtaining a recall of '1' for any of the categories with our current dataset and methodology is impossible. For evaluating queries, the method only retrieves 10 documents.  Each category contains at least 73 documents. For the dataset, the maximum possible score obtainable is about 0.24, which could potentially be obtained by the "space-news" category.  Other categories have lower maximums because they have a larger number of associated documents in the collection.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Wrap-Up-and-Next-Steps">Wrap-Up and Next Steps<a class="anchor-link" href="#Wrap-Up-and-Next-Steps">¶</a></h1>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>In this notebook, we looked at one method for implimenting the "Simplest Vector Space Model Instantiation" using Python.  This simple model has three main features:</p>
<ul>
<li>Bag of Word feature encoding using binary hits for terms</li>
<li>No normalization or weighting applied to terms or documents</li>
<li>Dot product used for calculating similarity scores between documents and queries</li>
</ul>
<p>A selection of PhysOrg articles was used to demonstrate the model.  In our analysis, the dataset was restricted to articles that were associated with the eight most prevelant categories.  Each document was associated with a query that was generated from its title.</p>
<p>In evaluating the method, we looked at the Top 10 highest-scoring documents for each query.  Using this subset, we looked at the category breakdowns for the returned documents, as well as the average F-Measure for each category and for the entire dataset.  Overall, the "Simplest Vector Space Model Instantiation" looked to be lacking in its ability to return documents associated with the same category as the query (i.e., relevant documents).</p>
<p>In a subsequent notebook, we will look to improve the VSM by implimenting various term and document weighting schemes discussed in lectures from the <em>Text Retrieval and Search Engines</em> Coursera course.  We will compare that model's performance to the performance of the model from this notebook.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
